, &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\"From the unreal\nlead me to the real!<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">From darkness lead me\nto light!<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">From death lead me to\nimmortality!\"<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<i><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Upanishads,\nthe Brihadaranyaka ( 1.3.28 )\u20145000 BC<o:p></o:p></span></i></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<i><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></i></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\"The Upanishads\ncontain such godlike fullness of wisdom on all things that I feel the authors\nmust have looked with calm remembrance back through a thousand passionate\nlives, full of feverish strife for and with shadows, ere they could have\nwritten with such certainty of things which the soul feels to be\nsure.\"-- <b>A. E. George Russell - Poet, mystic.</b><span style=\"background: yellow; mso-highlight: yellow;\"><o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<br />\n<span style=\"font-size: large;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In the 7000 year old\nUpanishads we get a glimpse into the workings of the minds of the great ancient\nIndian thinkers who were unhampered by the tyranny of religious dogma of opportunistic\nmen ( who became brokers of Gods or Gods themselves ), burnings at the stake,\npolitical authority, pressure of public opinion, seeking truth with\nsingle-minded devotion, rare in the history of thought.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The modern Indian sage\nMaharishi Ramana ( 1879- 1950 ) used to be in REM sleep for so long that his\nfriends in school used to kick him to wake him up, without effect.&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">After you die your naive\nfollowers will bury you, and then you are condemned for ever, with your soul\ntrapped on earth-- a horrible self inflicted punishment indeed..&nbsp;&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<o:p></o:p></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">This reminds me, I must put a post on this great man.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://1.bp.blogspot.com/-la5G-svbSdw/UQ4G_tvKR2I/AAAAAAAAdXA/gsIsRtZRTq8/s1600/imagesNHHE.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><b>OM is the four states\nof consciousness, as per Patanjali Yoga.</b><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">OM is the waking state\nor jagrat. Beta brain wave<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">OM is the dreaming\nstate or svapna.&nbsp; REM sleep state<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">OM is the deep sleep\nstate or sushupti. (dream-less deep sleep state , the delta brain wave)<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Om is the\ntranscendental state or turiya. (beyond all the states) , the fourth has been\ncalled nirvana.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://3.bp.blogspot.com/-Ini5bGuA6Tk/UQ4DFxL--sI/AAAAAAAAdVI/r5LoahVxcWM/s1600/imagesCAWL6LND.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"400\" src=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-Ini5bGuA6Tk/UQ4DFxL--sI/AAAAAAAAdVI/r5LoahVxcWM/s400/imagesCAWL6LND.jpg\" width=\"309\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-size: large;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-size: large;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><b><span style=\"color: red;\">Stage 1 ( Drowsiness )\n</span></b>- When you first fall asleep, you are in Stage 1 sleep which last about 8\nminutes. Eyes move slowly under the eyelids, and muscle activity slows down. You\nare between &nbsp;the alpha state and theta\nstates.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">This is a stage between sleep and wakefulness and you can be easily\nawakened. The muscles are active, and the eyes roll slowly, opening and closing\nmoderately, and you drift in and out of sleep.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: red;\"><b>Stage 2 (Light Sleep)\n</b></span>-Next, you go into Stage 2 sleep . Here eye movements stop, heart rate slows,\nand body temperature decreases. You are in Theta state, it gradually becomes\nharder to awaken the sleeper.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">When you meditate your brain goes from Beta 25 Hz\nto Alpha 12 Hz and then to Theta 7 Hz.&nbsp;\nTheta brain waves are associated with \" subconscious mind \" --\nwhile delta is connected with \" unconscious mind. &nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://3.bp.blogspot.com/-EOkl21dz0c0/UQ5RGk7tL_I/AAAAAAAAdoU/x1RmiXVsklU/s1600/imagesguio.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"255\" src=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-EOkl21dz0c0/UQ5RGk7tL_I/AAAAAAAAdoU/x1RmiXVsklU/s320/imagesguio.jpg\" width=\"320\" /></a></div>\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: red;\"><b>Stages 3 and 4 (Deep\nSleep) </b></span>- Then you enter Stages 3 and 4 (Deep Sleep). During stages 3 and 4, the\nslow wave sleep , you are difficult to awaken. People who are awakened during\nDeep Sleep do not adjust immediately and often feel groggy and disoriented for\nseveral minutes after they wake up.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Children may experience bedwetting, night\nterrors, or sleepwalking during Deep Sleep. You are in the Delta state&nbsp; of high amplitude waves at less than 3 Hz and\nsometimes in Theta. &nbsp;The sleeper is less\nresponsive to the environment; many environmental stimuli no longer produce any\nreactions.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><b><span style=\"color: red;\">REM sleep (Dream Sleep)\n</span></b>- At about 70 to 90 minutes into your sleep cycle, you enter REM sleep. You\nusually have three to five REM episodes per night. Your eyes jerk rapidly in\nvarious directions under your eyelids, thus the name Rapid Eye Movement (REM)\nSleep, where most muscles are paralyzed with occasional twitches. &nbsp;</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://4.bp.blogspot.com/-6kSLUq4mXDg/UQ41BZdBmTI/AAAAAAAAdcg/2oVict1WYwE/s1600/downloadFRYUIO.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"275\" src=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-6kSLUq4mXDg/UQ41BZdBmTI/AAAAAAAAdcg/2oVict1WYwE/s400/downloadFRYUIO.jpg\" width=\"400\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">This level is also referred to as paradoxical\nsleep because the sleeper, although exhibiting Beta EEG waves similar to a\nwaking state, is harder to arouse than at any other sleep stage.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Vital signs\nindicate arousal and oxygen consumption by the brain is higher than when the\nsleeper is awake. &nbsp;There is shallow rapid\nbreathing. &nbsp;REM stage has increased heart\nrate, raised blood pressure, erection in males, and the body does not regulate\nits temperature. Most of the vivid dreams occur during REM sleep, once awaken\nat this stage a person can remember the dreams. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The function of REM\nsleep is still NOT yet determined by modern science, and this is what I will\naddress here . All scientists know is that a lack of it will impair the ability\nto learn complex tasks. &nbsp;One approach to\nunderstanding the role of sleep is to study the deprivation of it. &nbsp;During this period, the EEG pattern returns to\nhigh frequency waves which look similar to the waves produced while the person\nis awake. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">A newborn baby spends\nalmost 9 hours , or 50% of the day in REM sleep. By the age of five or so, only\nslightly over two hours is spent in REM. &nbsp;An adult reaches REM approximately every 90\nminutes, with the latter half of sleep being more dominated by this stage. Adults\nspend &nbsp;20% in REM. Older adults spend\nprogressively less time in REM sleep.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://1.bp.blogspot.com/-brx6zAf6M0k/UQ422HCezhI/AAAAAAAAdeY/KTWwijmvOlM/s1600/images+(1).jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"372\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-brx6zAf6M0k/UQ422HCezhI/AAAAAAAAdeY/KTWwijmvOlM/s400/images+(1).jpg\" width=\"400\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Infants generally\nrequire about 16 hours a day, while teenagers need about 9 hours on average.\nFor most adults, 7 to 8 hours a night appears to be the best amount of sleep,\nalthough some people may need as few as 5 hours . <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Sleep deprivation\naffects the immune system in detrimental ways. &nbsp;Sleep is necessary for our nervous systems to\nwork properly. Too little sleep leaves us drowsy and unable to concentrate the\nnext day. It also leads to impaired memory and physical performance and reduced\nability to carry out math calculations. If sleep deprivation continues,\nhallucinations and mood swings may develop.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Dreams mainly occur in\nthe rapid-eye movement (REM) stage of sleep\u2014when brain activity is high and\nresembles that of being awake. &nbsp;REM sleep is revealed by continuous movements of\nthe eyes during sleep.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Dreams can last for a few seconds, or as long as twenty\nminutes. People are more likely to remember the dream if they are awakened\nduring the REM phase. The average person has about 3 to 5 dreams per night, but\nsome may have up to 7 dreams in one night.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The dreams tend to last longer as\nthe night progresses. During a full 8-hour night sleep, two hours of it is\nspent dreaming. Dreams can have varying natures, such as frightening, exciting,\nmagical, melancholic, adventurous, or <b>sexual.</b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Like I said , males\nhave an erection and females have enlarged clitoris during REM sleep. &nbsp;However this is NOT because of thoughts of\nsex, sorry.&nbsp; No matter what a dream is about,\nREM sleep will cause an erection in a man who is not impotent. &nbsp;&nbsp;Even newborn boys have a boner during REM\nsleep!&nbsp; &nbsp;The reason why men sometimes wake\nup with a hop is simply because they were having a dream when they woke\nup.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In females, nocturnal\nclitoral tumescence or NCT is accompanied by vaginal blood flow and\ntransudation ( lubrication ). &nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">So my dear\ngals take it easy, you are NOT so dirty minded, as you thought you were, and\nkept it as a dark secret. Just about 5% of your REM dreams were sexual. \u2014</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: red; font-size: large;\"><b>TEE HEEEE !!&nbsp;</b></span></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: red; font-size: large;\"><b><br /></b></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://2.bp.blogspot.com/-iuAG3vWef6o/UQ4brgdlBRI/AAAAAAAAdao/SVuW6gaRMds/s1600/bbgrr.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"299\" src=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-iuAG3vWef6o/UQ4brgdlBRI/AAAAAAAAdao/SVuW6gaRMds/s400/bbgrr.jpg\" width=\"400\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">During a normal night of sleep the\npenis and clitoris may be erect for a total time of from one hour to as long as\nthree and a half hours during REM.</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The fact that a penis\nbecomes erect and a clitoris becomes engorged, regardless of whether the dreams\nin progress have any erotic content or not is used to determine whether a man\u2019s\nimpotence is of physiological or psychological origin.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Twice the amount of\nblood flows to your brain during REM than when you are conscious.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Sigmund Freud, who\ngreatly influenced the field of psychology, believed dreaming was a\n\"safety valve\" for unconscious desires. Sorry Freud , we had enough\nof all our sex and ego theories-- think again ! You have NOT understood the Vedic theories from which you dipped abundantly.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; line-height: 150%; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://2.bp.blogspot.com/-o5_luY_9Czs/UQ8tbtTOCAI/AAAAAAAAdxM/lqVKT42meD0/s1600/imagesfgu.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" src=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-o5_luY_9Czs/UQ8tbtTOCAI/AAAAAAAAdxM/lqVKT42meD0/s1600/imagesfgu.jpg\" /></a></div>\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<span style=\"line-height: 150%;\">Note: &nbsp;Jew Sigmund Freud wanted to be cremated NOT buried-- shows the deep impression Hinduism had on him. He was afforded access to original Vedic Sanskrit texts by his sponsors Rothschild, the owners of British East India Company. The&nbsp;</span><span style=\"line-height: 24px;\">monopolized</span><span style=\"line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;media made a super hero out of him.</span><br />\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; line-height: 150%; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://4.bp.blogspot.com/-WUh8phVOtTw/UQ8usMPJJ6I/AAAAAAAAdxc/murAbBvD2tc/s1600/fui55.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"400\" src=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-WUh8phVOtTw/UQ8usMPJJ6I/AAAAAAAAdxc/murAbBvD2tc/s400/fui55.jpg\" width=\"266\" /></a></div>\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; line-height: 150%; text-align: center;\">\n</div>\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Alcohol reduces REM\nsleep, which aint good . &nbsp;Barbiturates\ncause drowsiness and have actions similar to alcohol in that they have a\nrebound effect and inhibit REM sleep. During REM sleep, the release of the\nneurotransmitters norepinephrine, serotonin and histamine is completely\nsuppressed. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">At least 95% of all\ndreams are not remembered. Certain brain chemicals necessary for converting\nshort-term memories into long-term ones are suppressed during REM sleep. Unless\na dream is particularly vivid and if one wakes during or immediately after it,\nthe content of the dream is not remembered, unless you write it down\nimmediately within a few seconds .<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Horses , other\nherbivorous ungulates and Zebra can sleep while standing, but must necessarily\nlie down for REM sleep. Some aquatic mammals and some birds can sleep with one\nhalf of the brain while the other half is awake, so-called unihemispheric\nslow-wave sleep. &nbsp;REM sleep and the\nability to dream seem to be embedded in the biology of many organisms that live\non Earth. All mammals experience REM. Dolphins experience minimum REM.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">During a typical\nlifespan, a person spends a total of about six years dreaming (which is about\ntwo hours each night)<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://2.bp.blogspot.com/-YzCxRe3vJb4/UQ41PmROsQI/AAAAAAAAdco/LuX3HY6hnGM/s1600/imagesCAKIYYI1.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"219\" src=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-YzCxRe3vJb4/UQ41PmROsQI/AAAAAAAAdco/LuX3HY6hnGM/s400/imagesCAKIYYI1.jpg\" width=\"400\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-size: large;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue; font-size: x-large;\"><b>So why is REM sleep so\nimportant?</b></span><span style=\"font-size: small;\"><o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Primarily REM is the\nbrain's way of&nbsp; ensuring that the\nconsciousness can be \u201cbooted up\u201d, in the absence of an external trigger. In the\nabsence of external stimulus, the brain might stay in&nbsp; deep sleep coma continuously until\ndehydration causes death. &nbsp;Humans cannot\ngo into hibernation. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Non REM sleep restores\nour body physiologically , as when the body is at reast more cell division and\nrepair happens..<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">REM sleep restores us\nmentally. &nbsp;REM sleep thus plays a huge role &nbsp;in learning and memory. During REM sleep, your\nbrain consolidates and processes the information you\u2019ve learned during the day.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">It forms neural connections that strengthen memory, and replenishes its supply\nof neurotransmitters, including feel-good chemicals like serotonin and dopamine\nthat boost your mood during the day. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">REM has an UNLEARNING\nand&nbsp; memory-consolidating function .&nbsp; Some of these memories taken in by our senses\nmay be rejected by the mind as useless, while others may be seen as valuable\nand retained.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">There is information\nexchange from the conscious left lobe ( for right handers ) to be sub conscious\nright lobe. Learned skills consolidate in the brain during the REM sleep. This\nis why after a brain storming session, the thoughts must be left to incubate\ntill an REM sleep.&nbsp; Major decisions are\nkept pending till then.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Can you imagine such\nideas were developed by Indian Maharisis 7000 years ago, during their dielectic\nsessions ?. These noble souls never debated !. &nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://4.bp.blogspot.com/-Qz2PFGSxFjA/UQ40jMSXijI/AAAAAAAAdcY/y6Yo6dKSpu4/s1600/fhui.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"289\" src=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-Qz2PFGSxFjA/UQ40jMSXijI/AAAAAAAAdcY/y6Yo6dKSpu4/s400/fhui.jpg\" width=\"400\" /></a></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The ancient Indian Vedic dialectic is based on\na dialogue between two or more people who may hold differing views, yet wish to\npursue truth by seeking agreement with one another. &nbsp;This is in contrast to debate, in which two or\nmore people hold differing views and wish to persuade or prove one another\nwrong, and thus a jury or judge or a vote is needed to decide the matter.</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">REM sleep, is\nparticularly important to the developing brain, possibly because it provides\nthe neural stimulation that newborns need to form mature neural connections and\nfor proper nervous system development.&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Deprivation\nof REM sleep early in life for new born babies can result in severe behavioral\nproblems, permanent sleep disruption, decreased brain mass, and will result in\nan abnormal amount of neuronal cell death.&nbsp;</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The amount of REM sleep\nin humans drastically decreases with age. About 50% of infant sleeping is spent\nin REM, compared to only about 20% for adults.&nbsp;\nFetuses and infants need heightened neural activity to stimulate brain\ndevelopment.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">REM has been shown to\nhave links to memory consolidation and to learning. Adults who are deprived of\nREM sleep have trouble remembering and learning new things. &nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">REM sleep stimulates\nthe brain regions used in learning. </span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">This\nis most important for normal brain development during infancy, which would\nexplain why infants spend much more time in REM sleep than adults . </span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">REM sleep gives the\nbrain a chance to exercise important neuronal connections that may otherwise\ndeteriorate from lack of activity.</span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Like deep sleep, REM sleep is associated with\nincreased production of proteins. People taught a skill and then deprived of\nnon-REM sleep could recall what they had learned after sleeping, </span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">while people deprived of REM sleep could not.</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://4.bp.blogspot.com/-d3Jk7RhdSi4/UQ4-fw0inFI/AAAAAAAAdiI/aCX_TrxpmaU/s1600/imagescvbfrr.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"310\" src=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-d3Jk7RhdSi4/UQ4-fw0inFI/AAAAAAAAdiI/aCX_TrxpmaU/s400/imagescvbfrr.jpg\" width=\"400\" /></a></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">People participating in\nan intensive language learning course experienced an increase of REM. This\nindicates that the brain requires more REM sleep in order to assimilate the new\ninformation.</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">REM sleep provided\nendogenous stimulation to prevent the brain from being shut down too long. &nbsp;REM sleep also acts as an escape valve for\nletting off the \u201cpsychic steam\u201d that accumulates from emotional stresses during\nthe day. &nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">People become anxious,\nirritable, and sometimes borderline psychotic, when they have been </span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">experimentally deprived of REM. </span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">During REM dreaming almost\nall neurons in all parts of the brain increase firing rate. This firing rate is\ngenerally considered indicative of biologically significant information\nprocessing.&nbsp;</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">This is at a time when there is\nalmost total muscle paralysis tonus during REM sleep. Only the respiratory and\ncardiac muscles maintain \u201cessential services\u201d , and the eye muscles remain\nactive, producing the rapid eye movements characterizing this form of sleep. The\nsmall muscles of the middle ear also remain active.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; One controls excitation, while the other controls\ninhibition of the Tamas-Rajas ( yin-yang ) . &nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">If a Parkinson patient like boxer Mohammed Ali\n, who received a lot of pounding on his head, holds out his hand , you will observe\nminor tremors. This is actually stimulated by slight, random differences in the\namount each of the two systems are firing.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The brain contains more\nthan 20 billion neurons. &nbsp;Each of these\nbrain cells have 10000 connections with other nerve cells through out the\nbrain. &nbsp;The electric, magnetic and\nchemical fields of your brain are in perpetual flux. &nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Smokers tend to sleep\nvery lightly and often wake up in the early morning due to nicotine withdrawal.\nAlcohol robs people of deep sleep and REM sleep and keeps them in the lighter\nstages of sleep.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot;
